welcome.confirmed_booking: Your booking is confirmed for these dates. Please have a look through the guidebook, where you'll find key information and our AI assistant. During your stay, this page will also let you see and control your room's heating and lighting.
welcome.during_stay: Welcome to our guidebook, where you can find information, chat with our AI assistant, and see and control your room's heating and lighting.

ha_dashboard.light_unavailable: Power is off at the wall switch.

chat.initial_message: Welcome! I'm Victoria, your AI assistant. Ask me anything about the guesthouse or your London trip.
chat.session_load_error: Could not load chat session. Please return to the guidebook and try again.

error_page.missing_code_message: Your link is missing a booking code. Please use the exact link provided to you.
error_page.contact_message: Please ensure you are using the correct, most recent link. If you continue to have trouble, please contact us through your booking platform.

content_html.wholeHomeBedroomsDetailed:
The house has the following bedrooms:

  • Ground Floor: Rooms 1 & 2.
  • First Floor: Room 3.
  • Second Floor: Rooms 4 & 5.
  • Third Floor (Loft): Room 6.
  • Basement: An additional sleeping space (Room 0) with a single bed is located in a semi-private area connected to the kitchen.
content_html.wholeHomeBedroomsCombined:
Each house has the following bedrooms:

  • Ground Floor: Rooms 1 & 2.
  • First Floor: Room 3.
  • Second Floor: Rooms 4 & 5.
  • Third Floor (Loft): Room 6.
  • Basement: An additional sleeping space (Room 0) with a single bed is located in a semi-private area connected to the kitchen.
content_html.storageUnderBed: You can create more space by storing luggage under the bed, as shown in this video:
content_html.storageInBed: This bed frame has a lift-up mattress with significant storage space inside, as shown in this video:
content_html.wholeHomeBathrooms:
There are three bathrooms available for your use:

  • Bathroom A: Located on floor -0.5.
  • Bathroom B: Located on floor 0.5.
  • Bathroom C: This is an en-suite bathroom located inside Room 3 on the first floor.
content_html.wholeHomeBathroomsCombined:
There are three bathrooms in each house (6 total), located as follows:

  • Bathroom A: Located on floor -0.5.
  • Bathroom B: Located on floor 0.5.
  • Bathroom C: This is an en-suite bathroom located inside Room 3 on the first floor.
content_html.bathroomA: We have designated Bathroom A as the primary choice for your room. However, Bathroom B is also fully available to you whenever needed!
content_html.bathroomB: You are welcome to use either Bathroom A (Floor -0.5) or Bathroom B (Floor 0.5). Please choose whichever is most convenient for you.
content_html.bathroomC: Your private bathroom is the en-suite inside your room.
content_html.bathroomShared:
Please be considerate of other guests:

  • Keep it Tidy: Please leave the bathroom clean for the next person.
  • Be Mindful of Time: During peak hours (typically 7:30 AM - 9:30 AM), please limit your usage to 15 minutes to ensure everyone can get ready for their day.
content_html.bathroomPrivate: This bathroom is private for your exclusive use.
content_html.kitchenShared:
The shared kitchen is located in the basement, through the door marked 'K'. Please:

  • Use Assigned Storage: Each room has a numbered space in the fridge and cabinets.
  • Clean As You Go: Place used dishes in the dishwasher. If the dishwasher is full, you are welcome to start a cycle. Otherwise, our staff will run it when it's full.
content_html.kitchenPrivate: The kitchen is private for your group's exclusive use.
content_html.kitchenBase:
Shared Supplies: Help yourself to complimentary tea and coffee, as well as basic condiments and spices.

Rubbish: The large metal bin is for recycling. General waste goes in the black bin.

Here are video guides for the appliances:

  • Induction Stove:

    As this is an induction stove, it requires a compatible pot or pan to be placed on the ring before it will heat up. The stove will not turn on or get hot without a pan on it.

  • Microwave:
content_html.windowsStandard: The window can be opened by pressing the button on the handle and turning it upwards.
content_html.windowsTiltTurn: These are "tilt and turn" windows. This video demonstrates how to open them for ventilation (tilt) or fully (turn):
content_html.noLaundry:
There are no guest-accessible washing machines on-site. A highly-rated local launderette is True Colours Launderette.

Towels are not changed daily. For fresh towels (max. once every 2 days), please leave used ones outside your door by 11:00am.
content_html.hasLaundry: The washing machine is located in the basement. Go to the kitchen, pass through Room 0, and then through the door marked 'X' (code 0987 followed by the tick). You will find it on the left at Z. This video provides access and usage instructions:
content_html.wholeHomeLuggage:
Self Check-in: From 15:00 onwards.

Luggage Storage: If you require luggage storage outside of check-in/out times, please message us. Depending on availability, you may be able to store bags in the front room (Room 1).
content_html.checkoutWholeHome:
Check-out is at 11:00 AM on {checkOutDateFormatted}.

You don't need to worry about any cleaning; our team will handle everything.

Luggage Storage: If you need to store your luggage üß≥ after check-out, please message us to check availability, as we cannot allow access to the cupboard (Cupboard V) for whole-home bookings due to volume.

‚ö†Ô∏è A quick but important request: Please be sure to take all your belongings from the room by 11am. Our cleaning team works on a tight schedule.
content_html.checkoutStatic:
Check-out is at 11:00 AM.

You don't need to worry about any cleaning; our team will handle everything.

‚ö†Ô∏è A quick but important request: Please be sure to take all your belongings from the room by 11am. Our cleaning team works on a tight schedule and will clear the room completely for our next guests.
content_html.checkinStaticDetailed:
Self Check-in: From 15:00 onwards on {checkInDateFormatted}.

Early Luggage Drop-off: From 11:00, you can use your front door code to access Cupboard V downstairs.

If you need to store bags before 11:00, please send us a message at the earliest the day before your arrival (on {dayBeforeCheckInFormatted}), and if we can accommodate it, we're happy to.

Early Check-in: I am not automatically updated on when specific rooms are ready, however you are welcome to check for yourselves from midday onwards. If you see one of our cleaning team, feel free to ask them as well. Please only leave your belongings inside the room if it is completely finished; otherwise, please use Cupboard V for storage.

This video shows the full process:
content_html.checkoutStaticDetailed:
Check-out is at 11:00 AM on {checkOutDateFormatted}.

You don't need to worry about any cleaning; our team will handle everything.

If you need to store your luggage üß≥ after you check out, you are welcome to use Cupboard V downstairs. Your existing entry code will continue to work for the front door and the cupboard until 14:00. If you need to arrange a later pick-up, please send us a message (ideally by {dayBeforeCheckOutFormatted}) to check for availability. We need to confirm because the house may be privately booked by a new group from 15:00, and for their privacy and security, access won't be possible after their check-in time.

‚ö†Ô∏è A quick but important request: Please be sure to take all your belongings from the room by 11am. Our cleaning team works on a tight schedule and will clear the room completely for our next guests.
content_html.heatingBase:
You can control the temperature in your room using the digital valve (TRV) on your radiator. Please keep the following in mind:

  • The temperature is limited to a range of 14¬∞C to 24¬∞C. Any setting outside this range will automatically revert after one hour.
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è The digital display is upside down! This is normal for this type of valve, so please bear this in mind when setting the temperature.

Cooling: We do not have air conditioning. We recommend keeping the window and curtains closed during sunny days and opening them in the evening.
content_html.heatingSmartAddon: For bookings with smart home controls, you can also adjust this from the dashboard on this page.
content_html.lightsNote: The physical light switch on the wall acts as a master switch for the smart lights in this room. To use the smart controls from this app, please ensure the corresponding wall switch is in the 'ON' position first.
content_html.wholeHomeRubbish: Rubbish bags can be left on the pavement outside the front door, in front of the black fencing. This is the standard, official procedure for our area, and the council collects it daily from this location.

static_html.what_not_to_bring:
We provide a variety of amenities so you can pack light! Here are some things you don‚Äôt need to bring:

  • Towels & Linens: Fresh bath towels and bed linens are provided.
  • Toiletries: Shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and hand soap are available.
  • Hair Dryers: Each bedroom has a hairdryer.
  • Adapters: Rooms have universal adapters on each side of the bed.
  • Extra Blankets: All beds include an electric under-blanket.
static_html.domestic_directions:
By Train/Tube: We are ~7 minutes from London Victoria Station. Exit towards Victoria Street/Vauxhall Bridge Road, turn left, and walk ~5‚Äì7 minutes. The house will be on your left.

By Coach: From Victoria Coach Station, it‚Äôs a ~10 minute walk.

By Car/Taxi: We do not have on-site parking. Please check Parkopedia for public garages.
static_html.airport_directions:
Book buses at National Express and trains at The Trainline.

Gatwick (LGW): Take a Southern Rail train directly to Victoria (~35 mins). It's cheaper and only slightly slower than the Gatwick Express.

Heathrow (LHR): Take the Piccadilly line (dark blue) and change at Hammersmith for a District line (green) train to Victoria (~50 mins total).

Stansted (STN): Take the train to Tottenham Hale, then switch to the Victoria line (light blue) to Victoria Station. You cannot use contactless from Stansted.

Luton (LTN): Take the train from Luton Airport Parkway to London St. Pancras (~40 mins), then the Victoria line to Victoria (~15 mins).
static_html.getting_around:
Public transport is excellent. Victoria Station is ~7 minutes away. The 24 bus stop near the house offers a scenic route through central London.

Use a contactless card for Tube/bus fares (they cap daily). London is very walkable, and you can also take a Thames river bus from Westminster Pier.
static_html.codetimes:
How to unlock: Press your palm to the black screen to activate the keypad. See the video playlist for a demonstration.

Front door & Luggage (Cupboard V): Your code is valid from 11:00 on check-in day until 14:00 on check-out day.

Bedroom/Bathroom/Kitchen: Your code is valid from 15:00 on check-in day until 11:00 on check-out day.

Locking from inside: This video shows how to lock your bedroom door from the inside for privacy.
static_html.ironing: An iron and a portable ironing mat can be found in the kitchen. The mat can be placed on a table or other firm surface for use. Please return both items to the kitchen when you are finished.
static_html.troubleshooting: If your digital door lock runs out of batteries, this video shows the simple replacement process:
static_html.contact:
For the fastest answers to your questions, please ask Victoria, our AI assistant. She has access to this entire guidebook and can provide instant help.

For other matters that require a human, please message us through your booking platform.

*FOR EMERGENCIES ONLY*, please WhatsApp call +44 7443 618207.
static_html.tv: Each bedroom has a Smart 4K TV with Disney+, Apple TV+, Amazon Prime Video, BBC iPlayer, and more. If a service is logged out or malfunctions, please contact us and we can log you in remotely.
static_html.local_guidebook:
Food

  • Regency Cafe ‚Äì traditional full English breakfast
  • Jugged Hare ‚Äì great pub across the road
  • Tachbrook Street Market ‚Äì local market for lunch on weekdays
  • Kimchimama ‚Äì casual Korean food (especially fried chicken)
  • Ben Venuti ‚Äì amazing Italian cafe around the corner
  • Tozi ‚Äì upscale Italian restaurant nearby
  • A. Wong ‚Äì Michelin-starred Chinese restaurant behind the house
  • Little Waitrose ‚Äì closest upmarket supermarket
  • Sainsbury's ‚Äì big supermarket
  • Rippon Cheese ‚Äì famous cheese store nearby
  • Dishoom ‚Äì famous Indian food (further away, book in advance)
  • Gold Mine ‚Äì great Peking duck (further away)

Sights

  • Wicked and Hamilton ‚Äì Two of the world's best musicals are right on our doorstep.
  • St James's Park ‚Äì A beautiful royal park, perfect for a stroll.
  • A great walk: Start at Big Ben, cross Westminster Bridge, and walk along the scenic South Bank to Tower Bridge.
